channel.title: An unpredictable choice?
channel.description:
Hi I'm french so my english is really simple! I try scar and I try to fin how to do a unpredictable choice betwen two action. My script is this: [sub]Procedure Harvest; begin if(ACTION1)or(ACTION2) then MoveMouseSmooth(x, y); end;[/sub]
I don't understand why it's always the second action that is executed... Help me plizz!
Apo

item.title: An unpredictable choice?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[code]var
x, y: Integer; //If you copy and paste this into the script, don’t redeclare these variables

function FindTheColor(var x, y: Integer): Boolean;
var
Colours: TIntegerArray;
begin
Colours := [961014, 3688806, 89754, 124657]; //Puts the colours into an array (Each thing is seperated by a comma)
Result := FindColor(x, y, Colours[Random(1000) mod Length(Colours)], 0, 0, 800, 600); //Searches for a random colour from the array.
//It gets a random number, then grabs the colour from the array at the modulus of the length of the array.
//That basically means it just chooses a random colour from the array, but this way is more random imo.
end;

procedure Harvest;
begin
if FindTheColor(x, y) then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x, y);
Writeln(‘We found the colour!’);
end;
end;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: An unpredictable choice?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Then what you’re doing is wrong.

iirc, your code says if either action1 or action2 is true then movemousesmooth.

It doesn’t do action1 or 2, they are booleans not procedures.

Use the code I posted.

Read full topic

item.title: An unpredictable choice?
item.dc:creator: @ApocalX ApocalX
item.description:
@ApocalX wrote:

I will try this, thanks a lot =D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2009, 07:05:35 am[/size][hr]My script:

function ACTION1 : Boolean;
begin
if(FindColor(x, y, 9610149, 0, 0, 800, 600))then result:= true
end;

function ACTION2 : Boolean;
begin
if(FindColor(x, y, 3688806, 0, 0, 800, 600))then result:= true
end;

Procedure Harvest;
begin
if(ACTION1)or(ACTION2) then
MoveMouseSmooth(x, y);
end;

So I would like to know how to do if I want the program choose at random one of the 2 actions. Here he always chooses the ACTION2. Is it more clear? ^^’

Read full topic

item.title: An unpredictable choice?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I gather you want to have 2 actions, and the script to pick a random one to do? I’m pretty terrible at programming now, haven’t done it for years so this is probably the long way ( [/disclaimer] ) but here is something you could use:

x:= random((2)+1);

if x = 1 then
begin;
end;
else
begin;
end;

Read full topic

item.title: An unpredictable choice?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

I’m not to sure what you are trying to say sorry, Could you post the entire script?
